question.title: Saving Hashmap of Player and an Integer
question.body:
I want to save a Hashmap to a file:

public static Map<Player, Integer> seconds = new HashMap<>();

It is to keep track of an integer given to a player, more specifically a timer. This is all working, but when the player leaves, the data is lost which is an issue.

I don't mind how it is saved, I just need it to be saved on player quit and retrieved when the player joins.

P.S. I am new to plugin development (and Java I guess), and I really have done as much research as possible but no luck with this problem.

I tried countless methods, such as:

  • Saving to JSON with GSON (and other methods)
  • I Looked into the Serializable class.

I wanted the file to be saved somewhere in the server. When a player leaves, the current Integer value must be saved to the Player. When a player joins, the Player's Integer will load and resume where it left off.
